reviews.review_msg: I cannot recommend professor Windel enough! He is passionate and whiling to learn and engage with students. Readings matter!
I felt that this prof seemed disengaged with the class during lectures and did not grade fairly. Was very boring during lectures. There are better quality profs than this one. Would never take again.

Took his class in Summer where it was just 1 month. Honestly, had a blast. HIST111 is about tech. He does a good job covering it and getting you thinking about tech & how it evolved in history. Made the dumbest mistakes in my final essay & he still gave me an A- Remember the names of the readings for final. You Nerd? Take it. Not nerd? Not for you
Worst prof ever. He is a very tough grader. And gives really bad feedback
The worst prof I ever had at sfu
cannot recommend professor windel enough!!! he is an incredibly passionate and interesting lecturer. if you get the chance, i would heavily urge anyone to take his classes!
My second class with Aaron, he is one of the most enjoyable and easygoing profs at SFU.
Professor Windel is a great prof! The grading was fair and the assignments were easy and also fun to write about. Pay attention to lectures and participate during tutorial.
nice human being but a tough grader. Write more than 2 pages to get a better grade.
tough grader.

I took this class during my first semester at SFU and I'm so glad I took it. Aaron grades fairly and gives great feedback after every assignment so you can improve on the next one. There were no tests and just short assignments all semester, highly recommend this class.

I've taken 3 classes with Aaron, but figured I would just rate my most recent one. Absolutely love this prof - kind, accommodating and passionate. Tends to lose track of time, resulting in a scramble at the end, and very reading-heavy. He rewards effort and attempts at participation, even if you're not perfect. Willing to clarify in office hours.

Could tell he genuinely cared for the topic and students. Because lectures were short, some concepts were more difficult to grasp under-explained, but he was easily accessible through email and office hours to clarify. Loved some topics, hated others but overall found Windel a very good and friendly professor.

Dr. Windel is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. I particularly enjoyed this class with him, I found the content very interesting and the way he taught it excellent. I was never confused about what was expected. His sources allow you to dive into the history in more interesting ways then just using a dry textbook. Can't recommend him enough!

Windel is not what one would call an historian. He uses poor definitions and under-explains concepts and historical events. For a course named Capitalism & the Making of the Modern World there is a horrifying lack discussion of capitalism and lots of socialism. Historical readings come from downtrodden poets. Count the mentions of Marx vs Smith...

I don't know about lower-division lectures, but professor Windel definitely knows how to run an upper-division seminar. With an emphasis on thorough analysis of the theses of the selected readings and a dense and highly-informative mini-lecture, every seminar was worth attending. Highly recommended for history majors - especially European focus

Aaron Windel is one of the kindest and genuine professors I have ever had. While a bit soft-spoken, he is extremely passionate about what he does and makes an effort to get to know and care for his students. His class is very reading heavy but if you put the effort and ask him for help when you need it, your grade will be fine.

Dr. Windel cares a lot for his students, and when asked will give good feedback. Grading criteria can be vague and ultra-precise, so make sure you do the readings and fully understand the content in seminar. A good amount of writing assignments so make sure not to fall behind. Takes a creative approach to class discussions, rewards participation.

Lectures are dry but he is very considerate for making sure that everyone can hear him (he uses a clip on mic). Many of the concepts I could relate back to courses in other disciplines so super useful. Sometimes he loses track of time and tries to quickly go through them in the last few minutes of lecture. However, he's always open to questions.

Dr Windel rewards you for your hard worksomething thats rare these days. He is also passionate and skilled lecturer, who will change the way you look at the world. I recommend this class for anyone from history majors to FASS students (me) to science students and beyond!
This course was the hardest course I have ever taken at SFU and I am a 4th year student. It felt like 5 credit class when it was only a 1st year 3 credit course. Not recommended unless necessary.

Film guides which required 2+ hours each and they're only worth 2% each. Three books and weekly readings on garbage PDF's which are required for tutorials. Lectures and slides are unorganized and often went overtime. Don't take this class as an elective as they have the same amount of writing as an English course does.

As a first year student this class was very hard for me. Professor winded was knowledgeable and interested in the content but was very hard on his students. students would get easily bored, but allowed opportunities for extra credit. what I hated the most was not getting a break. we would get one every week but he made us do stuff during that break

If you aren't required to take this class, avoid it all costs. The professor is nice enough but there is too much work. He is so confusing all the time. Very little guidelines and marking seems arbitrary. He always goes over the lecture time. And the breaks aren't useless since he will make you do work during them.

This class is extremely lecture heavy. There is no doubt that Aaron loves what he does, but PLEASE AVOID THIS CLASS. Every lecture ended 2 minutes late and occasionally tutorials ended really late too. he talks way too much and looses track of time. He would say last slide, but would rush the last 10 slides of lecture to get content through.

This professor needs to restructure his class. There is too many things to do on a weekly basis. He seems to believe that his class is the only one that matters. He blabbers during lecture without any real structure. He has very unclear grading criteria and makes it very difficult to get a decent grade

A lot of work for this class. Dr. Windel is clearly interested in the content but it unaware that students don't just have this class to work for. The film guides took over 5 hours to complete. this class was just so boring and annoying. Dr. Windel really needs to change the format of his class and make it more enjoyable for his students.

Professor Windel is passionate but his class is very difficult for a first year course. He has too many assignments including weekly questions, films guides and two papers. The reading are really heavy. He believes that students are only taking his class and nothing else. He has really high expectations and is not willing to listen to criticisms.

Aaron is a passionate individual, but this class was one of the worst I have taken at SFU. This is expected to be a first year course, but felt like a third year course. There is so much work involved in this class. There are 5 film guides, weekly questions, 2 papers, a presentation, and a take home final. Final is hard as it requires a lot of work

Dr Windel is clearly passionate about his topics, and that comes across in his lectures. However, he expects his students to share that passion, and assigns a lot of readings (including 2 books and 5 film guides). Watch out for reading quizzes, extra-credit opportunities in-class, and for the marks on your questions and tutorial participation.
Prof was really great, you could tell he cares about his students and the course was super interesting. Lots of reading but the content was engaging and I learned a lot.

Aaron is a really nice guy. I do not agree at all with the comments critiquing his lectures; I was thoroughly captivated and thought he was great at storytelling. I found the readings extremely interesting and well-written. Ample hints were given in class as to what would be on the exams  the hardest part was always the multiple choice section.

As a non-history major, I found this class to be a fine choice for an elective. One lecture per week was very nice and participation being worth 20% of your grade was excellent. The readings (textbook and primary sources) were usually dull, with a few interesting tidbits here and there. Exams were not a cakewalk but also not impossible.

Aaron is an amazing and passionate prof. He really cares about his students and you can tell he cares about the topic. He gives a lot of homework and a lot of readings, but as long as you put in the effort, you will be happy.

Dr. Windel's lectures are decent enough, but the amount of work he assigned was absolutely insane, considering it's a 100-level course and the vast majority of students were just taking it for a b-sci. There are 2 papers, a tutorial presentation, 5 films to watch, 4 novels to read, additional readings, and a take-home final. Would not recommend.
boring as heck man. lectures were so dull and test material came from the textbook.

Aaron is a great man and clearly he knows what he is talking about, but his lectures are unbearable. He is monotone and unfortunately his interests were not on par with mine with the course as he lectured mainly on artwork and nothing really much about the material in the txtbook. His tests are around 85% on what he lectures on

Aaron Windel is the kind of professor I want to listen to lecture without having to writ any exams. This class dates back from 55BC to present so be ready. Aaron tries his best but theres far too much info in this class to be covered. Dr. Windel is a super kind professor with alot of info and great to go see in office hours! I worked/read ALOT.

As far as seminars are concerned, a very good prof. A tad dry, but clearly passionate about the material, knowledgable, very approachable. Doesn't hold your hand, and gives very little in terms of instructions for assignments. But he's reasonable and flexible. Good insights, and picks very interesting material. Wholeheartedly recommend him.

Lectures for this class were poorly organized.  Lecture material and weekly readings at times did not relate to one another. PSA and essay questions on the midterm and final were fair, but the multiple choice section was very tough, as he expects you to know very specific details about the material.

He is a nice person, however as a professor he is alright. He assigns really unclear, and confusing essay topics, and he marks quite hard on them.  I took this course as a requirement, but I don't think ill take anymore classes with him.
The reason I'm still pursuing a history minor at SFU!

Before the first lecture we had over 126 pages of EXTREMELY dense reading. He's a great lecturer and awesome human being, although he says no trick questions: THERE ARE TRICK QUESTIONS! TA's mark your work but he gives examples of what he wants on Canvas. It's literally history of Britain 55 BC-2000 AD so expect to be overwhelmed - a lot happened.

Aaron is a fantastic prof who is really passionate about Victorian Britain history & makes the seminar discussion really interesting. There is a lot of reading but it is fascinating stuff and worth it! Really pay attention to what he is looking for in terms of paper-writing- you will do well if you put in the effort and do your research. Fun class!

One of the best profs at SFU, this guy is super into history and always willing to chat during office hours and after class, even non-course stuff. I didn't have him this semester, and I went to ask him for a reference, and we talked for almost an hour about music and stuff! The class would be harder for non-history students, but probably worth it.
Lovely man... So glad I took his class. Really patient and passionate. Wish he taught the tutorials cause the TAs sucked. Highly recommend Aaron as a professor
Lovely person and sweet guy. He loves to help students and shows passion and excitement. I am so glad he is a member of this department, and would recommend him to anyone. Great course :)
Amazing professor... Great lectures and generally a wonderful person to talk to. Would have loved if he taught the tutorial because he really is a wonderful professor

Absolutely an amazing and fantastic professor. He always keeps the seminar fun and entertaining by alternating between group work and entire class discussion. He also allows students to engage with the material in a different way, allows students to engage with history differently then other history professors. Clearly has passion for what he does.

Lectures expand more on smaller details, but give a bigger picture than what's in the book. In-tutorial tests with little warning, so you really have to read the books carefully. Genuinely enjoys lecturing and the material. It's a very engaging class, but there is a lot of work involved.

Lectures- he often doesn't go over big ideas and talks about smaller details in class. This makes class interesting, but hard to follow. Read every word of the textbook more than once and study for exams long in advance and you will do well. Overall a good class, I just found lectures hard to follow and there is a lot of reading.

He is very passionate about History and you can tell by the way he talks in lecture. His enthusiasm makes class fun! He's approachable and is okay with you coming to his office hours just to chat about history! Yoo have to really pay attention in class because he does not post notes online and you have to take notes on what hes saying.

Windel is nice and very passionate about what he teachers. Lectures can be hard to follow sometimes. Read the whole textbook and you'll do well. Participation in tutorials is worth 25% so do the readings, attend class and speak up. Overall, and enjoyable, informative class
Wonderful professor. Aaron has great lectures and tutorials. He really tries to tie the materials together from both classes. I am so glad I took his class. Best professor.
Amazing professor. Goes out of his way to help students. Lectures are fun & engaging. Best prof I've met at SFU. If you don't enjoy history, his classes will definitely change your mind!
Aaron is such a wonderful professor who was willing to go out of his way to help his students. He shows great passion for the subjects that he teaches. Amazing professor
He is a wonderful professor who is willing to help any student who puts in the effort. He is passionate and resourceful. All he wants is students to succeed
